required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chlortalidone and Bumetanide in Advanced Chronic Kidney Disease: HEBE-CKD Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Chlortalidone and Bumetanide in Advanced Chronic Kidney Disease: HEBE-CKD Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital General de México Dr. Eduardo Liceaga

clinical_study.source: Hospital General de México Dr. Eduardo Liceaga

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to demonstrate the possible benefit of a treatment based on double diuretic in patients with chronic kidney disease and severely impaired glomerular filtration rate. This is based on previous observations where the investigators found that volume overload is a frequent condition within this population and is strongly linked to an increase in morbidity and mortality. The investigators consider that this therapy could be beneficial given that most of these patients are treated with loop diuretics, however, with the passage of time, adaptive changes in the distal nephron occur that promote a decrease in the treatment effect. In this sense, thiazide diuretics at appropriate doses could 'break' the resistance, since their mechanism of action antagonizes the resistance mechanism. Unfortunately, to this day, this treatment has not been fully evaluated. Particularly in this type of population.
The investigators developed a study proposed as a double blind randomized clinical trial, where the population will be divided into two groups. A group will be given the standard treatment based on loop diuretic (bumetanide), while the other group will receive the intervention (bumetanide plus chlorthalidone). After a 30-day follow-up period, the results will be measured.
With respect to the effectiveness of the treatment, the decrease in volume overload by bioimpedance will be measured. While the occurrence of adverse effects during the same monitoring period will be observed.

primary_outcome.description: Measured by bioelectrical impedance analysis, compared to the initial measurement
decrease in blood pressure compared wit baseline measure (mmhg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Fractional Excretion of Sodium
secondary_outcome.description: Increase in the fractional excretion of sodium compared with the baseline measure
Decrease in extracellular water measured by bioelectrical impedance analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Extracellular Water / Total Body Water Ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Decrease in extracellular water / total body water ratio measured by bioelectrical impedance analysis

arm_group.description: This group will receive 3 milligrams of bumetanide per day for a week plus placebo (starch) that will simulate the chlorthalidone dose of the treatment group. In case the dose is well tolerated, the dose of bumetanide will be increased to 4 milligrams per day.

This group will receive 3 milligrams of bumetanide plus 50 milligrams of chlorthalidone per day, for a week. If the dose is well tolerated, it will be increased to 4 milligrams of bumetanide and 100 milligrams of chlorthalidone per day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- glomerular filtration rate less than 30 ml / min / 1.73m
- Without replacement therapy (dialysis or hemodialysis)
- Volume overload
- At least 100 ml per day of residual diuresis
- Use of a loop diuretic for at least one month
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergies known to diuretics
- Patients with severe infections
- Patients with hemodynamic instability
- Amputees
- Patients with cognitive impairment
- Patients with acute renal failure
- Patients with graft loss

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital General de México Dr. Eduardo Liceaga

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Hospital General de México Dr. Eduardo Liceaga

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited from the nephrology clinic in the Hospital General de México, between May and August 2019. All those with stage 4-5 chronic kidney disease, who had chronic use of loop diuretics and hypertension, were invited to perform an impedance measurement. Those with volume overload were invited to participate in the protocol.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: This group will receive 3 milligrams of bumetanide per day for a week plus placebo (starch) that will simulate the chlorthalidone dose of the treatment group. In case the dose is well tolerated, the dose of bumetanide will be increased to 4 milligrams per day. Bumetanide: Bumetanide

group.title: Treatment Grup
group.description: This group will receive 3 milligrams of bumetanide plus 50 milligrams of chlorthalidone per day, for a week. If the dose is well tolerated, it will be increased to 4 milligrams of bumetanide and 100 milligrams of chlorthalidone per day. Chlorthalidone: Chlorthalidone Bumetanide: Bumetanide

event.description: Nonfatal stroke, nonfatal myocardial infarction, and cardiovascular death
increase in serum creatinine levels greater than 0.3 mg / dl compared to baseline
Seric sodium less than 129 meq / liter
Seric uric acid greater than 8 mg/dl

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: Head of Nephrology Hospital General de México
